I really like Maoz from visiting it in other countries and at its previous location in Barcelona.  This one, sadly, was disappointing compared to my other experiences. Having just come from Amsterdam a few days prior where the fries can come with curry sauce (YUM), I was heartbroken to see that isn't an option here.  I could tell that the fries I got were the day-old ones probably lurking at the bottom of the trough.  They were kinda soggy, kinda chewy, and very blah.  I didn't know fries were capable of tasting bad! Also, the olives aren't pitted.  Whyyyyyyyy.  You may as well put plastic bits in the food. I wouldn't go back to this particular location, but 3 stars cuz I love Maoz in general.
